verses.kjv: Now Pashur the son of Immer the priest, who was also chief governor in the house of the LORD, heard that Jeremiah prophesied these things.
verses.ct: Now Pashur son of Immer, the priest who served as chief officer in the LORD's temple, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things.

verses.kjv: Then Pashur smote Jeremiah the prophet, and put him in the stocks that were in the high gate of Benjamin, which was by the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: So Pashur had Jeremiah the prophet beaten and locked in the stocks at the upper Benjamin Gate, near the LORD's temple.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Pashur brought forth Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then said Jeremiah unto him, The LORD hath not called thy name Pashur, but Magormissabib.
verses.ct: The next day, when Pashur released Jeremiah from the stocks, Jeremiah told him, "The LORD hasn't named you Pashur — he's named you Magor-missabib."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will make thee a terror to thyself, and to all thy friends: and they shall fall by the sword of their enemies, and thine eyes shall behold it: and I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall carry them captive into Babylon, and shall slay them with the sword.
verses.ct: "Because this is what the LORD says: 'Pay attention — I am going to make you a source of terror to yourself and to everyone close to you. Your friends will be killed by the swords of their enemies, and you will watch it happen. I will hand all of Judah over to the king of Babylon, and he will drag them away as captives to Babylon and put them to death with the sword.

verses.kjv: Moreover I will deliver all the strength of this city, and all the labours thereof, and all the precious things thereof, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah will I give into the hand of their enemies, which shall spoil them, and take them, and carry them to Babylon.
verses.ct: I will also hand over all the wealth of this city — everything produced by hard work, every valuable possession, and all the treasures of Judah's kings — to their enemies, who will plunder it all, seize it, and carry it off to Babylon.

verses.kjv: And thou, Pashur, and all that dwell in thine house shall go into captivity: and thou shalt come to Babylon, and there thou shalt die, and shalt be buried there, thou, and all thy friends, to whom thou hast prophesied lies.
verses.ct: As for you, Pashur, you and everyone living in your household will be taken into captivity. You will end up in Babylon, and that is where you will die and be buried — you and all your friends to whom you prophesied lies.'"

verses.kjv: O LORD, thou hast deceived me, and I was deceived: thou art stronger than I, and hast prevailed: I am in derision daily, every one mocketh me.
verses.ct: LORD, you persuaded me, and I let myself be persuaded. You are stronger than I am, and you won. Now I'm ridiculed constantly — everyone mocks me.

verses.kjv: For since I spake, I cried out, I cried violence and spoil; because the word of the LORD was made a reproach unto me, and a derision, daily.
verses.ct: Every time I speak, I have to cry out, shouting about violence and destruction. The LORD's message has brought me nothing but insults and mockery, day after day.

verses.kjv: Then I said, I will not make mention of him, nor speak any more in his name. But his word was in mine heart as a burning fire shut up in my bones, and I was weary with forbearing, and I could not stay.
verses.ct: So I told myself, "I won't mention him anymore. I won't speak in his name again." But his word burned inside me like a fire trapped in my bones. I was exhausted from holding it in, and I simply couldn't do it.

verses.kjv: For I heard the defaming of many, fear on every side. Report, say they, and we will report it. All my familiars watched for my halting, saying, Peradventure he will be enticed, and we shall prevail against him, and we shall take our revenge on him.
verses.ct: I've heard the whispered slander of many people — terror on every side! "Report him!" they say. "Let's turn him in!" All my closest companions are watching for me to stumble, thinking, "Maybe he can be tricked, and then we'll overpower him and get our revenge."

verses.kjv: But the LORD is with me as a mighty terrible one: therefore my persecutors shall stumble, and they shall not prevail: they shall be greatly ashamed; for they shall not prosper: their everlasting confusion shall never be forgotten.
verses.ct: But the LORD stands with me like a powerful warrior. That is why those who persecute me will stumble and fail to overpower me. They will be completely disgraced because they will not succeed, and their lasting humiliation will never be forgotten.

verses.kjv: But, O LORD of hosts, that triest the righteous, and seest the reins and the heart, let me see thy vengeance on them: for unto thee have I opened my cause.
verses.ct: LORD of Hosts, you examine the righteous and see deep into the mind and heart. Let me witness your justice carried out against them, because I have placed my case in your hands.

verses.kjv: Sing unto the LORD, praise ye the LORD: for he hath delivered the soul of the poor from the hand of evildoers.
verses.ct: Sing to the LORD! Praise the LORD! He has rescued the soul of the needy from the grip of evildoers.

verses.kjv: Cursed be the day wherein I was born: let not the day wherein my mother bare me be blessed.
verses.ct: Cursed be the day I was born! Let the day my mother gave birth to me never be called blessed.

verses.kjv: Cursed be the man who brought tidings to my father, saying, A man child is born unto thee; making him very glad.
verses.ct: Cursed be the man who brought the news to my father, saying, "You have a son!" — filling him with such joy.

verses.kjv: And let that man be as the cities which the LORD overthrew, and repented not: and let him hear the cry in the morning, and the shouting at noontide;
verses.ct: Let that man end up like the cities the LORD destroyed without mercy. Let him hear cries of alarm in the morning and battle shouts at noon,

verses.kjv: Because he slew me not from the womb; or that my mother might have been my grave, and her womb to be always great with me.
verses.ct: because he didn't kill me before I was born, so that my mother's womb would have been my grave, and she would have carried me inside her forever.

verses.kjv: Wherefore came I forth out of the womb to see labour and sorrow, that my days should be consumed with shame?
verses.ct: Why did I come out of the womb only to experience hardship and grief, so that my life would be spent in shame?
